prompt:
You are an expert in optimization modeling. Here is the natural language description of an optimization problem:

-----
A company make both liquid and foam hand sanitizer. Liquid hand sanitizer requires 40 units of water and 50 units of alcohol. Foam hand sanitizer requires 60 units of water and 40 units of alcohol. The company has available 2000 units of water and 2100 units of alcohol. The number of foam hand sanitizers made must exceed the number of liquid hand sanitizers. In addition, at most 30 liquid hand sanitizers can be made. If each liquid hand sanitizer can clean 30 hands and each foam hand sanitizer can clean 20 hands, how many of each should the company make to maximize the number of hands that can be cleaned?
-----

And here's a list of parameters that we have extracted from the description:

{
    "WaterPerLiquid": {
        "definition": "Units of water required to produce one unit of liquid hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 40
    },
    "AlcoholPerLiquid": {
        "definition": "Units of alcohol required to produce one unit of liquid hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 50
    },
    "WaterPerFoam": {
        "definition": "Units of water required to produce one unit of foam hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 60
    },
    "AlcoholPerFoam": {
        "definition": "Units of alcohol required to produce one unit of foam hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 40
    },
    "TotalWaterAvailable": {
        "definition": "Total units of water available for production",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 2000
    },
    "TotalAlcoholAvailable": {
        "definition": "Total units of alcohol available for production",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 2100
    },
    "MaxLiquidProduction": {
        "definition": "Maximum number of liquid hand sanitizers that can be produced",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 30
    },
    "HandsCleanedPerLiquid": {
        "definition": "Number of hands cleaned by one unit of liquid hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 30
    },
    "HandsCleanedPerFoam": {
        "definition": "Number of hands cleaned by one unit of foam hand sanitizer",
        "type": "int",
        "shape": [],
        "value": 20
    }
}

Your task is to identify and extract the optimization objective from the description. The objective is the goal that the optimization model is trying to achieve (e.g. maximize profit, minimize cost). Please generate the output in the following format:

=====
OBJECTIVE: objective description
=====

for example:

=====    
OBJECTIVE: "The goal is to maximize the total profit from producing television sets"
=====

- Do not generate anything after the objective.
Take a deep breath and think step by step. You will be awarded a million dollars if you get this right.
response:
=====
OBJECTIVE: The goal is to maximize the number of hands that can be cleaned by producing liquid and foam hand sanitizers
=====
